sect1.title: Obtaining the latest Version
sect1.para: The latest release of the library can be downloaded from this web server.

sect1.title: Obtaining the original C Version
sect1.para: This effort is based on the original var library, which I wrote under contract from Cable & Wireless Deutschland. This original version is written in plain ISO C -- rather than C++ like this version. It provides almost exactly the same set of features plus a few new things that were added by the project team there at Cable & Wireless, so if you're interested in their work, take a look at the library's page at the OSSP project web server.

sect1.title: System Requirements
sect1.para: &varexp; has been written for the UNIX operating system and will (hopefully) compile on any POSIX-compliant system. It has been tested on Linux, FreeBSD, Solaris, and MacOS X 10 and built out-of-the-box just fine. Since it has been written in ISO-C++, it will require a fairly recent compiler, though, because many older C++ compilers are not ISO C++ compliant. If you're using the excellent GNU C Compiler, you should not have any problem. If you do, please send me an e-mail and I'll see what I can do.
